data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point should always be face forward. One also needs to face forward to take the steps. If you start from 9 steps left, you return to the starting point in 10 steps. Thus, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Walking back home is walking back one way. Walking back to the beginning and then turning around is walking back on one side of the street. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, you should take 5 steps back because 5  6 = 5. To take 6 steps, you start from a pitch. To take four steps, you start from a pitch. The answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left and get back to 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around. Turn around. Take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around and turn around all go to the same starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Twice and quarter of a step. Even half a step. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can take any number of steps to return to the starting point. If you take 6 steps and turn around you will return to where you started. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you return to the starting point, you always have to Face backward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 2 steps to start. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When facing forward, a person always takes the first step forward. When facing back, a person always takes the first step forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Taking 2 steps left is the same as taking 6 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you are facing forward with your feet together, you should always start by facing forward. The first step is to turn your head and face forward, then take 9 steps left. Follow the other direction’s instructions and take 10 steps left. After the first step, take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left then take 1 step left again. This way, 3 steps from either side are taken backward. If you are facing forward with your feet together and facing forward, you should always take 6 steps left. The second step is to change the direction of your foot by taking 3 steps left. This way, 3 steps will be from either side and 5 will be from the other side. This way, 3 steps will be from the left and 3 will be from the right. This way, 6 steps will be from either side and 6 will be from the right. This way, 3 steps forward will be from the right and 3 steps forward will be from the left. This way, 3 steps will end in a 3, 6, and 4 from the right. This way, 4 steps will end in a 4, 7 and 4 from the right. Thus, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In the first step, each of the five direction should always face forward. The second 3 step is always going to face backward. The third step if going to the left and last one is going to go backward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you are facing forward, the first thing you need to do is face the same direction as you came from and have three steps to the right. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you are going to turn right to return to the beginning, you would also turn around to the left. If you are moving left, you would turn right to turn around to the left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 3 steps back and 1 step forward, you turn around and begin over again. If you take 6 steps back and 1 step forward, you turn around and end up back at where you started. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions for doing this have two parts and one of them is taking 7 steps and the other is taking 9 steps. Turn around and turn right. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 7 steps and turn left after taking 7. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Doing the following on the opposite side will either return you back to the starting point or make the whole circling path shorter. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You must first turn backwards in order to return to start. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can only return to the original point after turning around. If you take 5 steps and turn around, you will walk to the starting point only. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can take any number of steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The number of steps taken are 6 in the first sequence which is repeatable. If I took 8 steps left after the first sequence, I would be returning to the beginning point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person always feils forward, not backward. Always facing forward is the direction one is always trying to travel in. The number of steps in either direction are not different, but only amount traveled differently. So, you would need to travel backward (or take 9 steps left) to get back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is no.

Turn around. Take 4 steps. Return to the starting point. So, The answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When walking on a straight path, you always need to face forward. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn right means go around clockwise from start. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward you will always walk forward. You cannot take 2 steps backwards. So, the answer is no.

Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. So, the answer is No.

They are the same process and the starting point is the same location. So, the answer is yes.

Backward and forward have different axes of motion. In either direction, you always take the same steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Turn around. Turn around. Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person takes a 7 step turn around. A person turns around again and again. Upon returning to the starting point, the person takes 6 steps return to the beginning. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Walking forwards, you always face forward. When you walk backwards the direction you are facing can change to backward. Moving forwards, you never face forward. So, the answer is No.

You always take 8 steps left. In the left directions, you always face forward, while in the right direction, you always face right, so you need to take steps in order to go back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

There is always the person taking the first step. You cannot infer from the exercises that if you turn back at the start point, you will return to the first step. So, the answer is No.

Turn around means to go around a corner. Take 10 steps. Turn around means to go around the corner again. So, the answer is Yes.

Face forward to face forward. Step 1-4, -1, x 10 indicate the movement takes place to get you back to the beginning. Across all three steps, 1 is towards the ending and 9 is reversing one step backward. So, the answer is yes.

Take 5 steps. This is one of the easiest and most accurate methods to take. Take 7 steps. You are taking 7 steps and your return to the starting point is 5, 7, or 10 steps. So, the answer is yes.

Once you get to the starting point always face forward. Take all of the opposite steps with the same directions. So, the answer is No.

The first rule of a puzzle is To always face forward, so start with that. The second rule is To always face either backward or forward. The first rule is to always face forward. The second rule is to always face either backward or forward. So, the answer is No.

Turning around and turning right turn around and turn right, returning to the start. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Every time you look forward in the direction you are facing, you take 4 steps. If you always look backward, you take 10 steps backward in the direction you rewor. The instructions that were given would result in you losing 5 steps. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point should always be at the starting point. It is the most forward you will be facing and you should always go in the same direction. Taking 4 steps backward is a negative and will return you to the starting point. Going forward 2 steps backward means that you will take 2 steps backward. Going forward 3 steps right means that you will take 3 steps right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 4 steps right. Take 4 steps left. Take 8 steps left. Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Your eyes should always be facing forward. When facing east, your feet should be right, facing right is your feet should be in the left, and the right is your feet should be in the right. If you are facing on the right side of the street, you should always face forward. You can not go back. So, the answer is No.

To turn right, you first need to take 9 steps to your destination. So, the answer is No.

You always face forward when facing forward. If you face left, you always take 9 steps left. If you face right, you always take 5 steps left. If you face right, you always take 8 steps right. Taking 9 steps left is the same as taking 5 steps left. So, the answer is yes.

A person facing forward will always be facing forward. So, the answer is No.

You always take one step forward. If someone gives you 10 steps in the beginning, you always take 10 steps forward. If someone gives you 8 steps in the beginning, you always take 8 steps backward. If someone gives you 7 steps in the beginning, you always take a step backward. If someone does take 7 steps in the beginning, they constantly take a step backward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

It is important to always face forward. After a given amount of forward steps, you are taken to a backwards position. The number of steps when facing backward in this sequence is 7 steps backward. If you are taking a right step, and are facing left, you are taken back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.
